p: If the obtained Na +/K + ratio >1, it indicates a satisfactory natriuretic index [ 29], and if > 2, it indicates favorable Na + urinary excretion without excessive urinary K + loss, but if > 10, it indicates a favorable K + sparing effect [ 30]. If the calculated value of the Cl −/Na ++K + ratio is between 0.8 and 1.00, it excludes CAI activities, but if below 0.8, it is considered to have a strong CAI index [ 31].
